title: Won't Start
description: Diagnose a no-start condition on the Kymco Downtown 125i scooter, covering battery, starter, fuel, and ignition.

nodes.text: What happens when you press the start button on your Downtown 125i?

options.text: Nothing at all — no sound, no lights
Lights on but starter doesn't engage
Starter cranks but engine doesn't fire

nodes.warning: Wear eye protection. Battery acid is corrosive.
nodes.instructions: Locate the battery on the Downtown 125i under the seat. Measure with a multimeter (DC volts). Should read 12.4V+. Below 12.0V = insufficient for cranking. Clean corroded terminals. The Downtown 125i typically uses a YTX9-BS or similar battery.
Check main fuse (20-30A) and all secondary fuses in the fuse box near the battery. The Downtown 125i is a larger scooter with more electrical systems. Replace blown fuses with same rating only.

Downtown 125i interlocks: (1) Kill switch in RUN, (2) Side stand retracted, (3) Brake lever applied while pressing start. Toggle kill switch several times. The Downtown 125i may also require the rear brake specifically.
Listen for relay click when pressing start. Click + no crank = starter motor fault. No click = wiring/switch issue. Check for 12V at relay trigger wire.
Turn ignition ON — listen for fuel pump prime (2-3 second whir). The Downtown 125i is fuel-injected. No prime sound = check fuel pump fuse. Verify fuel in tank.

nodes.warning: High voltage — do not touch plug wire while cranking.
nodes.instructions: Remove spark plug, reconnect to cap, ground against engine. Crank and look for blue spark. The Downtown 125i uses electronic fuel injection with ECU-controlled ignition timing.

nodes.action: Charge with smart charger or replace.
nodes.details: The Downtown 125i uses a larger battery than small scooters. Check charging system (13.5-14.8V at 3,000 RPM) if it dies again. Battery lasts 2-3 years.

nodes.action: Replace blown fuse with same rating.
nodes.details: If it blows again, trace wiring for short circuit.
Clean switch contacts. Apply dielectric grease. Check side stand spring tension.

nodes.action: Check starter cable, replace motor if needed.
nodes.details: The Downtown 125i starter motor is accessible from the engine area. Check cable connection before replacing.
Check start button, handlebar switches, side stand switch, brake switch connectors. Water ingress common.

nodes.action: Check fuel pump fuse, connector, replace pump if failed.
nodes.details: Check fuse first, then 12V at connector. No voltage = wiring. Voltage but silent = pump failed.
The Downtown 125i has a larger fuel tank (~10 liters). Let pump prime before starting after running dry.

nodes.action: Replace spark plug first, then check ECU, coil, sensors.
nodes.details: New plug (check manual for spec). The Downtown 125i uses ECU-controlled ignition. A faulty crank position sensor or ECU can cause no-spark. Check for stored fault codes if possible.
Low compression = worn rings, head gasket, or tight valves. Check valve clearances. The Downtown 125i is liquid-cooled, so a blown head gasket may also show as coolant in oil or white exhaust smoke.
